flow control purpose: Match sender rate to receiver capacity
stop-and-wait protocol: Mechanism: Send one frame, wait for acknowledgment
sliding window protocol: Window size: Number of outstanding frames
congestion control: Purpose: Prevent network overload and collapse
Symptoms: Packet loss, increased latency, timeout
Techniques: Rate limiting, traffic shaping, admission control
Examples: TCP congestion control, QoS mechanisms
modern approaches: Credit-based flow control: Explicit buffer management
Rate-based flow control: Transmission rate regulation
Priority-based flow control: Different treatment for traffic types
Adaptive algorithms: Dynamic adjustment to network conditions
